item.title: A sshlockout Tutorial
item.description: This is a quick look at sshlockout and how to effectively use it to ban attackers on OpenBSD machines. The sshlockout program is a extra layer of security that bans IP addresses that have reached a maximum threshold of failed password attempts. The sshlockout program originates from DragonFlyBSD and has been ported to OpenBSD. If you’re from the Linux world this is similar to Fail2Ban and is a very simple program.

item.title: About me
item.description: Hello internet! My name is Dustin and I am a recent graduate Network Administration Technology student at my local college. In my spare time I enjoy working on my homelab and learning about both Windows and Unix-like operating systems. I have a love of Linux and the opensource projects that power it. I also like learning about cyber security and how to make systems more secure and reliable. I am a bit of a hardware enthusiast and love to build/upgrade computers and spend hours tweaking the performance and power usage to fit the use of the computer or server.
